result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio D Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Follow through with any treatment recommended.
No violent contact with Natasha D.
Attend Domestic Abuse Counseling and
Anger Management Counseling.

Defendant Antonio D Boyd in court with attorney Carl William Chesshir.  Shawn Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Chesshir advises the Court that they are ready to proceed to trial.  Attorney Chesshir plans to file an additional motion no later than Friday, October 30, 2015.  The State to file a response on Monday or first thing on Tuesday.  The Court to address the motion in limine and Attorney Chesshir's motion on Tuesday morning.   The trial is expected to last one day with each party allowed 3 strikes.
Jury trial - 12 person at 11-03-2015 08:30 am
Jury status hearing at 10-29-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Antonio D Boyd in court with attorney Carl William Chesshir.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense filed letter requesting an adjournment. Defense requests additional discovery from the State. State requests another date in 30 days for hearing. Court will set another date for jury status/jury trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio Boyd appeared in person - late. Lesli Boese appear for the State of Wisconsin.  Case recalled. Court orders warrant quashed (not issued).  Court reinstates bail (not forfeited). Defendant requests to discuss this matter with the DA's office. Court will give one more date in three weeks.
